title: create-a-payment-with-a-new-payment-plan
html:
• Header
  • Code Sample
  • Callout
  • Table

View page on sitePage historySuggested Edits 0
This endpoint creates a Customer Payment Plan by creating a Payment Plan with a Charge request. Creating a customer payment plan with a payment triggers the payment process to go through the following three steps: <span class="step_hl">Step 1:</span> Create the recurring plan if it does not exist. If there is any failure during this stage, the whole charge process will fail. <span class="step_hl">Step 2:</span> The normal payment process. <span class="step_hl">Step 3:</span> Create an association between the payment plan and the customer by creating a customer payment plan. Any issue at this stage will not affect the charge response, but will instead cause the response to populate the `customerPaymentPlan` field with NULL. 
## The request Create a single payment plan by sending a **POST** API request to the URI below. ### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://api2.checkout.com/v2/charges/card</p></pre> ### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://sandbox.checkout.com/api2/v2/charges/card</p></pre> ### Header parameters 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`Authorization` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`secret key`* 
`Content-Type` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`application/json` 
*For authorization, use the valid `secret key` of your Checkout.com account. You can find this in [The Hub](https://hub.checkout.com/). ### Request example 
Shell
rename · delete 
xxxxxxxxxx

2
    -H "Authorization: sk_test_55aedccc-7f53-4ccc-b0a6-d943decc3c31"
3
    -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8"
4
    -X POST
5
    -d '{
6
        "email": "sarah.mitchell@checkout.com",
7
        "description": "Test Recurring Charge",
8
        "value": 1000,
9
        "currency": "USD",
10
        "trackId": "TRK12345",
11
        "transactionIndicator": 2,
12
        "card": {
13
          "name": "Sarah Mitchell",
14
          "number": "4242424242424242",
15
          "expiryMonth": 6,
16
          "expiryYear": 2018,
17
          "cvv": 100
18
    },
19
    "paymentPlans": [{
20
      "name": "Movie Plan 1",
21
      "planTrackId": "Movie Plan 1",
22
      "autoCapTime": 0,
23
      "value": 1000,
24
      "cycle": "1m",
25
      "recurringCount": 12,
26
      "startDate": "2016-06-01"
27
    }]
28
    }'
Import from Gist
### Additional parameters The request payload fields are identical to the payload fields in a normal payment, with the addition of an array of payment plan objects. Note that the payment plan object does not contain the currency field. This is because the currency is inferred in the payment request. It should also be noted that payment plan objects can include an additional request field called `startDate`, which is detailed below: 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`card` <span class="field-type">Object</span> <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
The card used to make the charge. <span class="table-info">[Find out more](doc:cards)</span> 
`currency` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
Three-letter ISO currency code representing the currency in which the charge was made. <span class="table-info">[Currency codes](doc:currency-codes)</span> 
`email or customerId` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
The email address or customer id of the customer. 
`paymentPlans` <span class="field-type">Array</span> <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
An array of Payment Plan objects. Currently, only one Payment Plan per charge is supported. 
`trackId` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
An order tracking ID generated by the merchant. Maximum characters: 50. 
`description` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
A description that can be added to the object. Maximum characters: 100. 
`transactionIndicator` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
`2` for recurring **only**. 
`value` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
The value of the payment as a non-zero positive integer (no decimals). [Learn more](doc:calculating-the-value) about calculating the value. 
--- ## The response 
The full details of the payment plan will only be included in the initial payment response. They will not be present in the payment responses of subsequent recurring payments. 
Returns a Charge object with Customer Payment Plans created if the charge request is successful. Returns an error if something goes wrong. Possible values for the status field include `Authorised`, `Captured`, `Voided`, `Declined`, `Refunded` and `Flagged`. If you're having problems with this API, then ask our [support team](mailto:support@checkout.com) for help. Take a look at the example response below. ### Response example 
rename · delete
